properties.Short Description: One of the world's largest and most prestigious museums, the Met boasts a vast collection of art from around the globe. Don't miss the Egyptian Art galleries, the rooftop garden, or the special exhibits.
properties.Entry ticket: suggested admission fee $25 for adults, discounts for students and seniors.

properties.Short Description: The iconic 843-acre green space in the heart of Manhattan is a must-see for any visitor. From picnics on the Great Lawn to ice skating in the winter, Central Park offers something for everyone.

properties.Place: The American Museum of Natural History
properties.Short Description: Discover the wonders of the natural world at this world-renowned museum. Don't miss the Rose Center for Earth and Space and the Butterfly Conservatory.
properties.Entry ticket: suggested admission fee $23 for adults, discounts for students and seniors.
properties.Address: Central Park West & 79th St, New York, NY 10024

properties.Short Description: This elevated park built on an old railroad track offers a unique perspective on the city. Start at the southern end at the Meatpacking District and stroll north to the Javits Center.
properties.Address: Gansevoort St & Washington St, New York, NY 10014

properties.Short Description: Take in stunning views of the city from the observation deck of this iconic skyscraper. The 86th floor observatory offers panoramic views of New York City and beyond.
properties.Entry ticket: general admission fee $37 for adults, discounts for children, students, and seniors.

properties.Short Description: The bustling crossroads of the world is always a sight to see, and it's free! Don't miss the giant video screens, the costumed characters, and the street performers.

properties.Place: The New York Public Library & Bryant Park
properties.Short Description: The iconic main branch of the New York Public Library is a must-see for book lovers. Don't miss the Rose Main Reading Room, the original Children's Center, and the special exhibits in the Gottesman Hall of Planet Earth.
properties.Address: Fifth Ave & 42nd St, New York, NY 10018

properties.Short Description: This iconic museum is home to a collection of modern and contemporary art, including works by Pablo Picasso, Marcel Duchamp, and Jackson Pollock. Don't miss the museum's famous spiral ramp
properties.Entry ticket: general admission fee $25 for adults, discounts for students and seniors.

properties.Short Description: The MoMA is home to some of the world's most iconic modern art pieces, including works by Vincent van Gogh, Pablo Picasso, and Andy Warhol. Don't miss the special exhibits and the museum's film program
properties.Entry ticket: general admission fee $25 for adults, discounts for students and seniors.

properties.Place: Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island
properties.Short Description: Take a ferry to Liberty Island and get up close to the iconic statue. Don't miss the Ellis Island Immigration Museum, which tells the story of the millions of immigrants who arrived in the United States through Ellis Island
properties.Entry ticket: general admission fee $18 for adult, discounts for children, students, and seniors.
